content.description:
IMAGE 1: POTATO HARVEST IN JAVA, INDONESIA

Source: Wikimedia Foundation

IMAGE 2: POTATO HARVEST IN YORKSHIRE, UNITED KINGDOM

Source: David Wright

Potatoes were originally domesticated in the Andean Highlands and are now grown commercially in many parts of the world.
content.question:
A. Describe TWO similarities between the agricultural practices shown in Image 1 and Image 2.

B. Explain the process by which the potato was originally introduced to Europe as a food crop.

C. Explain how the agricultural practice shown in Image 2 may affect local water resources.

D. Explain the degree to which the practice of monocropping may increase the economies of scale for farmers.

E. Explain how increasing demand for processed potato products in developed countries may affect potato farmers in developing countries.

frqParts.text:
A. Describe TWO similarities between the agricultural practices shown in Image 1 and Image 2.

B. Explain the process by which the potato was originally introduced to Europe as a food crop.

C. Explain how the agricultural practice shown in Image 2 may affect local water resources.

D. Explain the degree to which the practice of monocropping may increase the economies of scale for farmers.

E. Explain how increasing demand for processed potato products in developed countries may affect potato farmers in developing countries.

unit.text: 5: Agriculture and Rural Land-Use Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Explain how maps, images, and landscapes illustrate, or relate to geographic principles, processes, and outcomes.
